author: killari.
content: <https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3529> This EIP claims that 50% is the capped gas refund that you can get for a transaction. That is, you can send a transaction that actually consumes double the amount of gas than what is seen on paper, and then gets half of it refunded when the execution finishes. Where does this number come from and is it still accurate?

author: killari.
content: that eip proposes that its capped to 25% actually, is that implemented?

author: sky.cactus
content: <https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3529> was included in London <https://github.com/ethereum/execution-specs/blob/master/network-upgrades/mainnet-upgrades/london.md> and it limits refunds to 1/5 of the total gas used over the course of the transaction.
